hive_text_custom.text:
: So, I'm here with Dan, and Dan lives in Bali, Indonesia where he runs his business operations. And we’re going to talk about good cities to do business. 
So Dan what are your favorite cities or cities that do you think would be a good place to start up an international business?
: Well, it really depends what kind of business you're doing, I suppose. If you are an English speaker and you like to

other English speakers, the Philippines is a famous place for going to hire English speakers. A good city to do that would be like Cebu City in the south of the Philippines, or Davao in the south of the Philippines. You can also look at Manila but it’s not such a nice city, and the workers are a little bit more expensive there. 
If you’re looking for lifestyle like a great lifestyle, maybe you’re not hiring so much or doing financial things but it’s just on your laptop, say, Bangkok is a great place. Some of the best food in the entire world, you’ve got great night life, and you can travel anywhere from Bangkok. 
Bali obviously is a great place, if you’re not such a city person and you like a more relax environment but it’s still very developed. I mean, you can eat a hundred different nationality of food, walk down the street and you can get food from all around the world, whereas if you want something a little bit more of an adventure and
, you could select Nha Trang in South Central Vietnam.
: Now, you have connections in China, could you recommend any places in China?

: Well, unfortunately for me in China is that a lot of my travel there has been super business focused. And I'm always going to the place where there’s the factory or the bank or the connection. And so I haven’t really gotten a great chance to explore places that you might go for lifestyle. But
off the top of my head

. One is Shanghai. 
And really to me—you know, I’ve been to a lot of big cities, but Shanghai is a whole another level of big. It’s like the movie Blade Runner mixed with the movie The Matrix. I mean, it is so futuristic and I just—it really blew me away to be in the city. And it also has hints of Europe. I mean, Shanghai is famous for being famous in the 1920s and '30s with ex-patriots coming there, and it’s very international. And it really does have sort of a charm that a lot of places in China lack because cities in China are so new; a 10 million person city just sort of

. 
Another place that sticks out for me is Shaman, and that’s close to Taipei and it’s one of the nicer big cities in China. There’s a lot of more nature-oriented green park stuff like that. So those would be the two places, but especially Shanghai, I feel like I could live there for a few years.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 5) Shaman is nice because it is _____ .

hive_text_custom.text: When you hire someone, you give them a job. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Our company is now hiring.
 He was hired and then fired.

hive_text_custom.text: A secluded place does not have many visitors. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We stayed on a secluded island.
 My town is secluded in the moutains.

hive_text_custom.text: is the route most people take.
refers to places few people visit. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
When I travel, I try to stay off the beaten track.
 We found a great village off the beaten track.

hive_vocab.word: Off the top of my head

hive_text_custom.text: Off the top of my head
We say 'off the top of my head' when we say ideas without much thought. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Do you know what companies are hiring?
 
Off the top of my head, I think Sony is hiring.

For fashion, one place that sticks out is Paris.
 Another place that sticks out is New York.

hive_text_custom.text: A big city just sort of
The phrase 'pop up' means to  appear, and 'overnight' means very rapidly. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
In spring, flowers pop up overnight.
 In a recession, homeless people seem to pop up overnight.
